result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of misdemeanor court costs within 120 days of the Court's acceptance of this agreement, unless a payment plan is reached with the Clerk of Courts. 
-Comply with any recommendations made through the AODA mental health evaluations that were completed as part of the underlying CHIPS case (22JC13). If necessary, upon request the defendant will sign any and all releases of information necessary for the DA's office to verify compliance. 
-The defendant will complete the 27 week Men's Nonviolence Class at the Domestic Abuse Intervention Programs (DAIP) in Duluth, MN, through which he is enrolled already as of the filing of this agreement.
 If despite good faith efforts made by the defendant, the evaluation or any recommendations therefrom cannot be completed as set forth above in this condition, it is the responsibility of the defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, to contact the District Attorney's Office at 715-395-1218 to request an extension of the date for completion. The District Attorney's Office has sole discretion whether to agree to modify the date for completion of the evaluation. Failure to request an extension in this circumstance constitutes evidence that the defendant has not made good faith efforts to complete the program prior to the expiration of the agreement.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the State shall be free to argue for any disposition it deems appropriate, up to and including the maximum sentence provided by law. 
-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c).
-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to amend the charge to one county ordinance disorderly conduct with no additional penalty beyond the monies already paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Jon Bachand

records.addlTxt: No in person contact with Victim 1 except instructed by DHHS.

9:28 AM Defendant Jacob Jon Bachand in court.  Attorney Jacob S Gondik in court for Jacob Jon Bachand.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates has amended the charge. Will be a DJOC. Attorney Gondik agrees. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the DJOC. DA will monitor agreement.
State addresses bail. Asks for modification to signature bond, no in person contact except as directed by DHHS

2:59 PM Defendant Jacob Jon Bachand in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jacob S Gondik in court for Jacob Jon Bachand. Attorney Gondik received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Requests status conference. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Gondik withdraws motion that was filed. Court accepts withdraw of motion. Court sets status conference with all parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Attorney's Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
Arraignment on August 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Victim 1, except the defendant may have contact with Victim 1 by other than phone/text/zoom, or a supervised in person visit if supervised by the Douglas County Department of Health and Human Services.

records.addlTxt: 03:38 PM Defendant Jacob Jon Bachand in court.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not obtained counsel as he did not qualify for court appointed attorney. Defendant would like to waive his time limits. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his time limits. Court waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob Jon Bachand

No contact with victim 1

02:05 PM Defendant Jacob Jon Bachand in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Jacob Jon Bachand in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob Jon Bachand appeared by video means with Attorney. Court asks if there will be no contact with the address listed on the Complaint. State indicates there is. Atty Craker gives an alternative address.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.   States request on bail: $750 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or the address listed in the ID Key. State gives prior criminal history indicating defendant does have a prior Domestic Violence in 2016. There is one F.T.A. and a Bail-Jumping charge from 2016. 
Atty Craker indicates defendant does have strong family ties and defendant is from here. Defendant is currently employed. 
Court Orders $750 cash bail with conditions of No contact with victim 1 
Defendant does not qualify. Court inquires if defendant would like to waive time limits for the purpose of giving him more time to hire counsel. Defendant would like waive time limits. Court accepts waiver of time limits as they are voluntarily and freely made.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
